equipped.name: (a key fashioned from a bright sea shell)

mobs.long_desc: A hemlock effigy stares at nothing with sightless eyes.
mobs.desc: The figure before you has been woven of hemlock boughs and shaped to form a vague, manlike silhouette. A separate weave has been attached to represent a block-like head with two dark holes for eyes. Long branches swing at its sides for arms and twigs form crude hands. The whole structure stands well over seven feet tall.

mobs.long_desc: The huge, gray milgwn lowers its bristled tail and snarls.
mobs.desc: The milgwn snarls at you and stalks closer, tail extended and legs stiff. It closely resembles a fox, but you've never seen a fox of such size! It is closer to the size of a wolf. Stripes cross its face giving it a mask similar to a badger or raccoon.

mobs.long_desc: The wary milgwn dances lightly out of reach.
mobs.desc: The fox-like milgwn regards you warily from the corner of its eyes as it dances away on quick feet. A light dun color, it blends beautifully into its surroundings. Darker stripes cross its face giving it the appearance of a raccoon. A feral stripe traces its spine from neck to tail-tip.

mobs.long_desc: The fierce uiske glares at you, hunger deep in its fiery eyes.
mobs.desc: The tall uiske stands here in the shallows. Outwardly, it much resembles a fine, black horse, but its sharp teeth and claws tell another story. Bits of kelp decorate the water horse's dark mane and whip past you as it tosses its head. It is magnificent. Its fiery eyes promise you wonders you've never imagined. You find yourself fighting a sudden desire to... go for a ride... Something tells you that you'd probably not survive the uiske's type of ride.

mobs.keywords: woman-dancer woman virgin carefree young dancer
mobs.long_desc: A carefree young woman reels about drunkenly.
mobs.desc: A lovely young woman whirls and twists about in a frenzied, drunken dance. Her long white robes wrap about her then fly outward again as she enters another spin. In one hand she holds a drinking cup. The other firmly grasps a brightly colored ribbon. A crown of greenery rides upon her head keeping her hip-length hair under control.

mobs.long_desc: A drunken young man wobbles through a few dance steps.
mobs.desc: The young man has had more than enough to drink. He has difficulty standing, let alone dancing. Of course, his wobbling gait probably helps his dance a bit. His trousers are grass-stained from his many falls. The tambour in his hand chimes almost in time with the music of the dance. A dark fluid splashes out of the cup in his other hand as he reels laughing into a spin.

mobs.long_desc: The Brew Master stands here, tending to his concoction.
mobs.desc: A large man stands behind a bubbling pot. A large leather apron protects him from the heat of the fire beneath it. In one hand, he holds the largest ladle you've ever seen. This must be the man responsible for the amazing brew all the dancers seem to enjoy so much.

mobs.keywords: raibeart leader final dance ray raibeart-of-the-dance
mobs.long_desc: Raibeart, the Leader of the Final Dance, waits here for a wish.
mobs.desc: A stern-looking man of powerful build, he stands very tall, with flowing robes sewn from the finest linen on his body. He wears many pieces of golden jewelry, and a garland of rowan on his head. He glares about himself angrily.

mobs.keywords: exhausted-dancer maiden-cianalas maiden cianalas exhausted dancer
mobs.long_desc: An exhausted dancer is here, ready to swoon.
mobs.desc: The tired maiden is having trouble staying upright. Grass stains mark her white robes on her side and near her knees. She sways drunkenly back and forth a little bit, then seems to find her balance again.

mobs.long_desc: A lovely young woman swims through the water, smiling at you.
mobs.desc: A bewitchingly beautiful young woman swims through the water more easily than you ever imagined possible. Your eyes goggle a bit as you realize that she doesn't seem to have anything covering her but the water. Her hair flows around her in a huge fan-shaped halo. She casts a heart-breaking smile your way and comes closer.

mobs.long_desc: A lovely young woman swims through the water, glaring at you with hate.
mobs.desc: A beautiful young woman swims easily through the water. She glares about her angrily and slaps at the water as though at some unseen foe. Suddenly she notices you and turns. Her gaze chills you. She throws back her head frequently to let loose a laugh of insane glee..

mobs.keywords: soul-bound-phantasm mist phantasm bound spirit soul shimmer shimmers section
mobs.long_desc: A section of mist shimmers slightly.
mobs.desc: An iridescent section of the mist solidifies into the form of a young woman with webbed hands and flippers for feet. She floats here, bobbing gently along in the mist, guarding its secrets.

mobs.long_desc: Seinneadair is here, researching a spell.
mobs.desc: Seinneadair looks up and regards you through sea-green eyes. Her long chestnut-brown hair swirls about her body with a life of its own as she lifts her hands in preparation of a spell. You might find her beauty distracting if she didn't seem so angered at your interruption.

mobs.long_desc: Something dangles innocently from the ceiling.
mobs.desc: Long strands of seaweed dangle from the ceiling, moving under their own power back and forth across the cave. They twist and search, seeking something to grip and haul up for sustenance.

mobs.long_desc: A young man is here, tending to his garden.
mobs.desc: A young man in a dirt-stained tunic looks at you warily. Bits and pieces of various plants peek out from several pouches attached to his belt.

mobs.long_desc: A clear, jelly-like blob is anchored firmly to the rock.
mobs.desc: The giant sea-squirt looks like a tube of clear jelly. It has anchored itself here in the shallows, taking advantage of the tides to bring its food. As you watch, it sprays out a small fountain of water. Now you know where it gets its name.

mobs.long_desc: The uaine bocan weeps to herself as she perches on a tree limb.
mobs.desc: A greenish light surrounds the shade of a once-beautiful young woman. She hugs herself tightly as tears run down her face. A bright spot of red appears near her stomach and she stretches a blood covered hand toward you pleadingly, revealing a circular pattern cut into her midsection.

mobs.keywords: burnt-togair burned bundle hemlock wish boughs
mobs.long_desc: A partially burned bundle of hemlock boughs lies here.
mobs.desc: The bundle of boughs may have once been human-shaped but is now a burned- out husk of itself. It's difficult to say for sure what its makers intended it to represent. Whatever their original wishes for this were, they are now lost.

mobs.long_desc: The mighty Witch of the Sea stands before you impatiently.
mobs.desc: The great Uaine Witch resembles nothing more than a construct of kelp and hemlock. Her figure is almost shapeless. Two long, supple boughs act as arms. Deep blue eyes shine from the blocky head. You can't see what it may be using as legs. A fish darts out from its body, looks at you, and swims back inside. The full, wild magic of the ocean crackles about her.

mobs.keywords: woman-dancer woman virgin carefree young dancer
mobs.long_desc: A carefree young woman reels about drunkenly.
mobs.desc: A lovely young woman whirls and twists about in a frenzied, drunken dance. Her long white robes wrap about her then fly outward again as she enters another spin. In one hand she holds a drinking cup. The other firmly grasps a small hemlock bough. A crown of greenery rides upon her head keeping her hip-length hair under control.

mobs.long_desc: A black-clad crone wanders through here.
mobs.desc: She's a very old human woman, with wispy grey hair held back by a black coif, and a shapeless black dress covering her hunchbacked body. She totters along, mumbling mystic things to herself.

objects.ground: A worn gardening tool is lying here.

extras.text: Bits of dirt still cling to the sharpened end of the spade.  The worn handle is held together by a bit of twine.  Looking more closely, you can see where the handle was cracked some time ago.  Old, but still useful for digging.

objects.ground: A small orange berry has rolled here from its bush.

extras.text: The ripe gooseberry spills tart juices from its plump body.

objects.ground: A vaporous circle of light is floating here.

extras.text: A vaporous circle of white mist hangs in the air, held together by some invisible force.  No visible boundaries define it for your eyes.  It is quite simply..  THERE...  Contained...

objects.short: a key fashioned from a bright sea shell
objects.ground: A delicate key made from a sea shell lies here on a gold chain.

extras.text: The tiny key has been smoothly cut in a single piece from a brightly colored sea shell. Shades of gray, green, and blue shimmer across its surface. A fine-linked chain of gold is attached to the key.

objects.short: a wave-shaped piece of gold wire
objects.ground: An oddly bent bit of gold wire lies here.

extras.text: Several lengths of golden wire have been bent into a wave-like pattern then soldered together to create this unique bauble.

objects.ground: A creased and oily parchment scroll has been dropped here.

extras.text: An old, worn piece of parchment has been carelessly crumbled up into a ball. The writing on it is smudged, but still readable.

objects.ground: A tarnished brass torc is partially hidden by dust.

extras.text: The thick metal torc is heavily tarnished but you can still make out a distinct pattern of rowan leaves heavily engraved on the surface.

objects.ground: A shining gold torc has been forgotten here.

extras.text: The brilliantly polished gold neckpiece has been inlaid with a repeating pattern of rowan leaves overlapping hemlock.  It is incredibly heavy.

objects.short: a goblet engraved with rowan leaves
objects.ground: An engraved goblet looks ready to tip over.

extras.text: The pewter goblet has been engraved with a repeating pattern of interlocked rowan leaves, giving its surface a bumpy texture.

objects.short: a goblet engraved with hemlock leaves
objects.ground: An engraved goblet looks ready to tip over.

extras.text: The pewter goblet has been engraved with a repeating pattern of interlocked hemlock leaves, giving its surface a bumpy texture.

objects.ground: A brightly colored ribbon has fallen off someone's clothes here.

extras.text: The bright twist of red and green ribbon looks very festive.

objects.ground: A large metal ladle lies here, lost without its pot.

extras.text: The large ladle has been well-used.  Its handle is worn smooth and shiny.  Its bowl looks like it could fill more than one cup with each scoop.

objects.ground: A sharp steel knife stands up from a block of wood.

extras.text: The razor-sharp knife looks like it could peel the skin from your fingers without you noticing the cut until you started bleeding.  A custom-carved wooden handle makes it easy to grip.

objects.ground: A bottle of seawater lies here, sloshing about.

extras.text: A deep blue potion sloshes about inside the thin glass bottle with a life of its own. Miniature waves strike the sides the swing back the other way as if they seek a way out.

objects.ground: Fresh white flowers adorn a small circlet of rowan twigs.

extras.text: The stems of tiny white flowers have been painstakingly woven into a basic net of rowan twigs to create this lovely circlet.

objects.ground: A translucent wave of bowl-shaped energy floats here.

extras.text: A shimmering wave of translucent energy has been shaped into a concave bowl of protection.  Faint swirls of gray, blue, and green wash through it in pulses like waves past an ocean shore.

objects.ground: A tangled pile of seaweed lies here in a heap.

extras.text: Red and brown seaweeds have been woven together to form a skirt of sorts.  It is very sturdy and would hang down past your knees although you have doubts as to how well it would protect your modesty.

objects.ground: A burnished wooden recorder rests here, waiting to be played.
objects.action_desc: The sound of the Sea's Flute is haunting and dulcet.

extras.text: The wood of the recorder glows with the deep purple of a fish-oil finish.  The sound that issues from it is incredibly sweet and haunting.  It seems to play itself as your fingers run over its smooth curves.

objects.ground: A clear blue ring rests on the ground.

extras.text: A series of playful dolphins chase each other around the perimeter of the sea-blue ring.  It is difficult to determine exactly what the ring is made of -- clear, yet neither crystal nor glass.

rooms.name: Near the Breakers
rooms.description: Salty spray showers on you from all sides as the raging sea booms into the row of breakers to your north. Turbulent water and a stiff easterly make passage to the north impossible. You are awed by the strength of the currents dashing between the boulders with each successive wave. The narrow safe zone continues to your east or you can climb the lone breaker blocking your passage south. A sheer cliff soars above your head to an unknown height.

East.description: A rocky band of treacherous shallows cuts through the narrow safe-zone between the breakers and the open sea.

Up.description: Sharp hand holds form a slippery but safe path upwards.

rooms.name: Near the Breakers
rooms.description: Salty spray showers on you from all sides as the raging sea booms into the row of breakers to your north. Turbulent water and a stiff easterly make passage to the north impossible. You are awed by the strength of the currents dashing between the boulders with each successive wave. The narrow safe zone between breakers continues to your west. The calmer waters of the open sea spread to the eastern horizon.

South.description: The rocky shallows look less dangerous ahead where they pierce the surface at the base of a lone breaker.

West.description: A rocky band of treacherous shallows cuts through the narrow safe-zone between the breakers to end at the base of a high, chalky cliff.

rooms.name: A Sheltered Cove
rooms.description: You find yourself squeezed into a narrow, rocky pocket between the rough, chalky veneer of the cliffs and the craggy face of a lone breaker. Fine- grained sands slide under foot as you look around. Cool air soothes you in breath after refreshing breath. Relaxation steals its way into your tired muscles despite your best efforts at resistance... Closing your eyes, you note the muted quality of the waves which allows you to hear a faint, haunting melody drifting past like the memory of a lullaby...

South.description: Restless waves lap gently against the only shore of this private beach. The water is very shallow; just the right depth for a refreshing, cool splash or an invigorating dash around the breaker.

Up.description: The jigs and jags of many outcroppings provide good grips for ascending the damp back of the sentinel breaker.

extras.text: Thin root-like tendrils grasp the rocks in an unbreakable grip. What appears to be many seaweeds at first glance proves to be a single entity on closer examination. One incredibly hardy alga seizes its chance at life in this narrow zone where sea water mists the cool air just enough and lone rays of sunlight sneak by the cliff.
The thick calcium coat of the cliff crumbles beneath your fingers, leaving a damp white powder clinging to your hand.

The creamy sand is amazingly dry. You would have expected it to feel damp beneath you, but through some miracle, no water penetrates it. The soft powder shifts to conform to your shape then slides back. Almost no trace of your passage is left behind...

rooms.name: The Sentinel Breaker
rooms.description: Fish scales and bones litter the top of the breaker. Apparently, this is a favorite dining spot for some animal feeding from the sea. Looking about, you can't really blame it. You have a commanding view in four directions and can easily leap down in any of them -- the shallow breakwaters to the north, rocky shallows east and south, or into a sheltered cove to the west.

North.description: Clear water churns in the narrow safe-zone between this breaker and the larger gathering of its brothers to the north.

East.description: Smaller rocks make a miniature version of the northern breakers. The footing looks tricky but not impossible.

South.description: Rocks give way to a sandier bottom, but still make the landing a little tricky here.

West.description: A small overhanging lip of rock obscures your view of the cove below.

extras.text: A slightly smelly collection of discarded fish heads, tails, fins, and scales stick to the breaker's top in every sheltered cranny.

Fine bones and thick ones lie among the litter of fish heads. THICK fish bones? Another look reveals that some of these aren't from fish at all. Tiny finger bones from a human hand are caught deep in a narrow fissure. Suddenly, the breeze seems more chill than refreshing...

rooms.name: In the Rocky Shallows
rooms.description: A jumble of head-sized rocks act as the advance forces for a large, isolated breaker to the west. A current sweeps the main force of the sea to the north only to crash on the large breaker field that guards the east section of this tiny peninsula. Calmer, gentler shallows lie south.

North.description: A low, churning surf roils over a narrow stretch of negotiable water between here and the mighty line of breakers.

South.description: The small field of head-sized boulders fades into a pebbled shallow.

Up.description: A series of slippery, moss-filled holes provides a natural ladder to the top of the outcrop.

rooms.name: In the Rocky Shallows
rooms.description: A muted roar is all that remains of the sea's violence in this shallow nook. Small rocks and large pebbles roll back and forth across the sandy bottom as the cool waves roll up past your ankles, hushing themselves as they lap gently at the tiny alcove to your north. The strong easterly slips around your body, toying with your hair before continuing in a swirl up the cliff to the west and south. The waters deepen slightly to your east.

North.description: Ripples of fine-grained sand slip stealthily into a private cove. Three rocky walls shelter the tiny open space, making it seem... cozy.

East.description: A calm succession of waves rolls past the south side of a lone breaker to finally lose their energy here.

South.description: A small stretch of your legs will land you on the shore of a narrow tongue of land leading up to the main peninsula.

rooms.name: In the Rocky Shallows
rooms.description: Wavelets twist a path between the miniature islands formed by a pile of jagged rocks. The crashing of their louder cousins against the large field to the north mutes all other sounds except the whistling of the wind. Such a sad tune! It almost sounds like the breezes themselves are weeping as they pass through and over this tiny bay. A large boulder breaks the waves to your north or you can continue along this watery path of rocks to the east, the south and the west.

East.description: Deeper water drowns the rock field just ahead.

South.description: Tiny rock islands bravely poke their heads above the waves, creating a series of stepping stones.

West.description: Smaller rocks lie like dulled gemstones on a sandy bottom.

Up.description: The rugged face of the boulder is not as steep as you first thought. It would be very easy to reach the top.

extras.text: The greenish sea-foam fills the spaces and narrow gaps of the field of head-sized stones. The stiff easterly breeze sculpts the foam into fantastic forms that are just as quickly blown away by the strength of their own creator.

rooms.name: In the Rocky Shallows
rooms.description: Chill waves spray your body with tiny droplets of water as they crash onto shore here, drowning the small stepping stones that lead toward land to the west. More rocky shallows continue to the north and the south. In the distance to your north you can see a huge field of protective boulders standing guard against the sea's incursions onto land. A green tinge marks the waters to your east. The waves in that direction look like they've sprouted hair.

North.description: A perilously slick vanguard of rocks shatters each wave rolling in from the sea.

South.description: The calmer waters south look like glass except for the tiny eddies that barely disturb the surface.

West.description: The waves seem to tire and falter as they rush to the west.

rooms.name: In the Rocky Shallows
rooms.description: The water here is deceptively still. As you examine its cool depth, you note the tell-tale surface dips and ridges that mark strong currents sweeping over the rocky bottom. You can continue your watery stroll to the north or to the east. A narrow tongue of land forms a challenging shoreline to the west.

North.description: A gathering of larger rocks holds sway against the force of the waves.

East.description: The deceitfully smooth surface continues to the east, heading toward open sea.

West.description: The flat face of rock is topped by a path leading upwards to the heights of the small peninsula.

extras.text: The clear red substance oozes between your fingers and falls back into the water with a plop. A slimy residue is stuck on your hand now. Ick.

rooms.name: In the Rocky Shallows
rooms.description: Rolling waves lap at your feet as they rush by in a hurry to crash on the nearby shore. Swirling colors of blue and green wash the sandy bottom before breaking apart into foamy sheets on the small peninsula to your northwest. The shallows continue to your north and west, barely caressing the rocky shoreline.

North.description: The rock-lined shallows swirl with foam. In the distance you see a lone boulder in front of a more deadly line of breakers.

West.description: A gentle slope leads up to shallower water, barely ankle deep, before foaming against the shore.

rooms.name: In the Sandy Shallows
rooms.description: Near-silent wavelets sweep ripples into the sandy bottom in their last romp towards shore. You are sheltered from the bite of the wind by the rocky thrust of a narrow isthmus between the mainland and the peninsula to your north. You can reach the isthmus by going north or you can continue your walk along this quiet beach to the west.

North.description: A low tumble of rocks leads up to the isthmus.

West.description: The sandy beach front continues ahead.

Up.description: A haunting melody drifts to your ears from above.

extras.text: You see nothing exceptional about the light brown sand of the shallow bottom. The ripples do form a rather pretty pattern of ridges...
The low isthmus winds upward in two directions: north toward the peninsula and south toward the mainland.

rooms.name: In the Sandy Shallows
rooms.description: The water works hard to keep the beach covered, but it seems to be losing the battle. Each successive wave has a shorter and shorter reach up the shoreline. They've failed to erase a deep set of tracks that run along the beach and into the water. A deep blue line indicates a steep dropoff in the ocean just a few feet off this narrow spit of land. The beach continues north and east.

North.description: The water-swept beach line follows the edge of the peninsula.

East.description: The cool blue waters drown the sandy spit to the east.

Up.description: A sad, piping tune drifts through the air.

extras.text: The track is slightly larger in width than your hand and very deep, as though the animal was moving at great speed across this beach. The top portion is oval -- similar to that of a horse -- but two forward facing triangles indicate some type of projection, like a claw.

rooms.name: In the Sandy Shallows
rooms.description: A narrow strip of shallow water drowns the rock-strewn sand before it drops off the edge into the depths of the ocean itself. Deeper spots indicate where tidal pools form and provide shelter to the sea-dwellers. A steep cliff towers above you and keeps you sheltered from the ravages of the wind. This shallow strip continues to the south and the west.

South.description: The sandy shallows look almost glassy above the calm bottom.

West.description: More ankle-deep water sloshes against the shore.

Up.description: The clear air looks refreshing. This is a very sheltered spot, so there is almost no breeze, even above you.

rooms.name: In the Sandy Shallows
rooms.description: Knee-deep water sloshes against the cliff in a cold advance. Your teeth chatter in a syncopated rhythm as the spray coats your body. A breeze passes overhead at a great height, playing a sad tune across the peninsula and almost washing away an odd, whinny-like cry. The narrow shallows continue to the east and west. To the south, you can see a dark line of much deeper blue indicating the beginnings of the ocean depths.

East.description: The shallower strip of tidal pools beckons to you, promising relief from the chill sea water.

West.description: The knee-deep waters continue ahead and north around a corner of the cliff.

Up.description: Cold air fills your nostrils with a sharp tang in the stronger breeze above you.

rooms.name: In the Sandy Shallows
rooms.description: You find yourself unconsciously ducking even though the cliff's overhang clears your head by several feet. The action of innumerable tides and waves has worn the cliff back to create a deep cut resembling a tunnel leading to the north. You can enter a less claustrophobic stretch of waters to the east.

North.description: Shallower water washes against the overhang, making a deep cut into the cliff. The tunnel-like overhang continues for some distance north.

East.description: The water seems a little more friendly for some reason....

rooms.name: In the Sandy Shallows
rooms.description: The cliff overhangs here, creating a cave-like atmosphere. Sounds echo loudly through the north-south tunnel, turning the slow slap of the waves into loud reports of impact. Sea water drips from above, trickling down your face and finding every possible opening in your clothing. You shiver as the chill creeps into your very bones.

North.description: The partial tunnel continues for a ways ahead.

South.description: The end of the overhang leads out into the open and to the sea as the cliff curls away to the east.

rooms.name: In the Sandy Shallows
rooms.description: You find yourself shivering in the chill shadow of rock in the last open section of the overhang. Just to the north it becomes a true cave. Open sea lies to your west but shallower water leads in a straight line through this tunnel-like overhang to the south. A strong musky odor seeps from the north.

North.description: Dark water pours out of the cave mouth, tainting the shallows around your feet. A cold, dank odor rides the breeze from its depths.

South.description: Shallow water washes against the cliff, then retreats back to sea as reinforcements continue the assaults on the integrity of the land.

rooms.name: A Sandy Cave
rooms.description: Dark as a pit, the walls of the cave seem to close in on you as you look around. The entrance is barely visible and growls at you with the voice of the sea through sharpened stalactite teeth. A foul, untraceable odor permeates the air. A vague sense of menace raises the hackles on the back of your neck. You startle as a splash sounds from behind. Something moves toward you through the water. Something large...

South.description: The mouth of the cave grins at you in morbid humor.

rooms.name: Above the Shallows
rooms.description: The cold winds flick over your body teasingly. Even the tiniest openings in your clothing are sought out and taken advantage of. The view almost makes it worth it. A deep blue stretch of ocean passes away to the west and you can easily follow a rocky path up the peninsula with your eyes. There is no sign of a source for the melody drifting to you on the breeze. Maybe the wind itself is the creator...

North.description: A step forward will place you halfway up the winding isthmus path.

West.description: The air over the ocean has a crystal clear quality that seems almost magical.

Up.description: The sad melody wavers by above.

Down.description: The ocean covers the sand in a brilliant pattern of gray, blue, and green.

extras.text: The rocky path looks like it's more suited to mountain goats than to humans, but you could probably make the steep climb. It looks like it gets a lot of traffic.

rooms.name: Above the Shallows
rooms.description: The cold winds flick over your body teasingly. Even the tiniest openings in your clothing are sought out and taken advantage of. The view almost makes it worth it. A deep blue stretch of ocean passes away to the west and you can easily follow a rocky path up the peninsula with your eyes. The merest hint of a melody is audible through the breezes but you cannot locate the source.

North.description: A tree leaf bobs on the breeze.

Up.description: The open sky beckons to you.

Down.description: The shallows splash against the skirt of land that daringly invades the sea from the peninsula.

rooms.name: Above the Shallows
rooms.description: The cold winds flick over your body teasingly. Even the tiniest openings in your clothing are sought out and taken advantage of. The view almost makes it worth it. A deep blue stretch of ocean passes away to the west and you can easily follow a rocky path up the peninsula with your eyes. The merest hint of a melody is audible through the breezes but you cannot locate the source.

East.description: A small step will safely land you on the rocky path that traverses the isthmus.

South.description: Crystal clear air snaps before you in the cold.

West.description: Crystal clear air snaps before you in the cold.

Up.description: The breeze swoops down and teases your brow, soothing your weariness with a cool touch and a faint melody.

Down.description: Shore dwellers splash through the tidal pools below you. In the distance, you detect a faint drumming sound, like hoofbeats.

extras.text: The steep path threads its narrow way onto the peninsula.

rooms.name: Above the Shallows
rooms.description: The cold winds flick over your body teasingly. Even the tiniest openings in your clothing are sought out and taken advantage of. The view almost makes it worth it. A deep blue stretch of ocean passes away to the west and you can easily follow a rocky path up the peninsula with your eyes. The merest hint of a melody is audible through the breezes but you cannot locate the source.

East.description: The pathway winds up the isthmus a short distance ahead.

Up.description: A lone cloud hurries across the sky high overhead, lost without a crowd of its fellows.

Down.description: The sea below flirts boldly with the shore.

rooms.name: Above the Shallows
rooms.description: The cold winds flick over your body teasingly. Even the tiniest openings in your clothing are sought out and taken advantage of. The view almost makes it worth it. A deep blue stretch of ocean passes away to the west and you can easily follow a rocky path up the peninsula with your eyes. The merest hint of a melody is audible through the breezes but you cannot locate the source.

West.description: A directionless, haunting keen rises and falls with the crashing of the waves, nearly  drowned by their vigor. The strong easterly breeze presses against your back, urging you forward.

Down.description: Waves flick against the defenses of the land far below your feet.

rooms.name: Above the Shallows
rooms.description: The cold winds flick over your body teasingly. Even the tiniest openings in your clothing are sought out and taken advantage of. The view almost makes it worth it. A deep blue stretch of ocean passes away to the west and you can easily follow a rocky path up the peninsula with your eyes. The merest hint of a melody is audible through the breezes but you cannot locate the source.

North.description: Some distance ahead of you, the top of the cliffs tips slowly forward, overshadowing the sea far below.

East.description: The chill winds course out of the east to wrap themselves around your body in a freezing embrace.

Down.description: A series of tidal pools boldly defend the shore against the confident advances of the sea far below.

rooms.name: Above the Shallows
rooms.description: The cold winds flick over your body teasingly. Even the tiniest openings in your clothing are sought out and taken advantage of. The view almost makes it worth it. A deep blue stretch of ocean passes away to the west and you can easily follow a rocky path up the peninsula with your eyes. The merest hint of a melody is audible through the breezes but you cannot locate the source.

North.description: The narrow isthmus pathway tops the cliff just ahead.

West.description: For as far as you can see, the vastness of the empty sea writhes upward in one series of waves after another, creating endless patterns of blue, green, and gray, quietly amusing itself in its loneliness and flirting with the sky.

Down.description: The sleek waves turn to silver far below you.

rooms.name: Above the Shallows
rooms.description: The cold winds flick over your body teasingly. Even the tiniest openings in your clothing are sought out and taken advantage of. The view almost makes it worth it. A deep blue stretch of ocean passes away to the west and you can easily follow a rocky path up the peninsula with your eyes. The merest hint of a melody is audible through the breezes but you cannot locate the source.

North.description: A low line of shrubbery guards the height ahead of you. They look like staunch defenders.

East.description: Cold air currents make progress to the east almost, but not quite, impossible.

Down.description: Your view of the shallows is partially blocked by an overhang of the cliff. The portion you can see clearly foams with the passage of many fish. At least... you HOPE they are fish...

rooms.name: The Isthmus
rooms.description: The jagged rocks make it difficult to find secure footing on their sea- slicked surfaces by threatening to reward any slip with a shredded leg. In spite of the inhospitality of the land, this is a main landing spot for people ascending the peninsula. A shoe is caught between the rocks and you note several tatters of clothing which provide evidence of the passage of many humans. You can enter the shallow waters to the north and the east or continue up the isthmus to the west.

North.description: The gentled ocean sweeps smoothly into a tiny cove.

East.description: Pebbles and larger rocks wait to greet you as you wade into the churning sea water licking against the isthmus.

West.description: Rocks have been broken and sheered off to form a narrow pathway up the spiked spine of the peninsula.

extras.text: The knife-edged rocks thrust boldly upward, promising deep lacerations to any traveller foolish enough to attempt a crossing that is less than cautious.

The round piece of leather once wrapped snugly around a small foot. A single thong threaded through the edges to hold it in place. Evidently, the force applied by the knife-edged rocks was enough to snap the thong, allowing the shoe to be pulled off and held by the rocks like some bizarre keepsake.
Threads and small pieces of cloth are caught between the teeth of the rocks, remnants of some meal taken from many travellers.

rooms.name: The Isthmus
rooms.description: Someone has broken a narrow pathway through the jagged rocks. It is rough and narrow, but is navigable. It begins climbing a steep grade to the north, leading to the main body of the peninsula. The rocky spit of land to your east is undeveloped. Shallow water splashes against the isthmus to the south and the west.

East.description: The pathway peters out to unchanged and indifferent jags of sharpened rock, stretching up and threatening your legs with lacerations.

South.description: The waves slap rhythmically against the rocky shoreline. Again and again, the land withstands the assault on its defenses.

West.description: A slow beat sounds out again and again as the waves strike the unyielding defenses of the isthmus.

Up.description: The narrow pathway winds up the steep slope of the isthmus.

extras.text: Broken tops are the only remains of the jagged rocks that once thrust boldly up here. They have been used to fill in the angles and holes that once separated them from each other. Seaweed has been packed into the remaining spaces in an attempt to make the makeshift road more stable.

rooms.name: The Isthmus
rooms.description: The jagged path slips through a series of switchbacks as it mounts the slender spine of the isthmus. The ocean booms toward you with great strength out of the west. It slides in with a quieter, silken whisper from the east. Spray coats you even at this height above the waves. You can follow the path up or down from here.

West.description: The isthmus ends in an abrupt drop-off.

Up.description: The crude path continues upward to the top of the cliff.

Down.description: The footing on the downward path looks slick and dangerous.

extras.text: Crushed rock has been packed tight with seaweed to smooth out the natural cavities and heights between the boulders that make up this isthmus.
The edge of the cliff threatens to break away beneath your weight. A few small rocks clatter down the face and into the shallows below.

rooms.name: The Isthmus
rooms.description: The pile of loose boulders that makes up the isthmus brims against the peninsula. This spot marks one end of the highest switchback on the crude isthmus pathway. You gaze about,taking in the view now afforded you. The vast ocean grumbles in annoyance to the east. It washes the southern coastline with a gentler mien. The view north is blocked by a thick growth of trees and low shrubs. The path continues, in better condition, to the west. Glancing down, you see the pathway descending to the shallows.

West.description: The pathway has been broadened and paved with flint just ahead.

Down.description: The crude pathway leaps downward. Looking at it, you shudder at the thought of the treacherous descent.

extras.text: The line of boulders that form the isthmus once made a tall column up the side of the cliff. Some mighty force ripped the column from its home to form the narrow land bridge.
Deep blues, grays, and greens shift and play in an ever-changing, never- ending pattern. The grumbling of the sea is a comforting murmur, like the low protestations of a caring mother.
Twisted to odd shapes by the winds that sweep the peninsula, the trees and shrubs that grip the top of the cliffs bend and sway easily, long conditioned to the capricious breezes.
Founded on less uneven ground, the path here is much more stable than the switchbacks below.

rooms.name: A Flint Path
rooms.description: The flint paving leads up a gentle slope to the top of the peninsula some distance ahead. It is lined on both sides by a series of large, rectangular stone blocks backed by forest. The sounds of music and laughter echo down the path. You can descend along the spine of the isthmus to the east. South of you a drop-off marks the edge of the cliff. A stand of small trees and shrubbery lies west.

East.description: The fine flint paving ends and becomes a much cruder crushed rock pathway as it begins its descent along the spine of the isthmus.

South.description: Far below, the ocean laps at the rocky shores unrelentingly.

West.description: A daring bastion of trees and shrubbery eagerly stretches branches wide, embracing the sea winds.

Up.description: The path takes a steep leap upwards then passes beneath a series of stone monoliths.

extras.text: Fine fracture lines criss-cross the paving. A symbol is engraved on one of the surfaces.
Intertwined vines form a circle.
The trees and shrubs atop the cliff are twisted into bizarre shapes. The winds sift mournfully through their branches.

rooms.name: A Small Herb Garden
rooms.description: Tiny groups of several different medicinal herbs are neatly arranged in this garden. Their sweet scent refreshes your weary body. A thin line of brush shields the garden from the flint path east of here and another protects it from a forest to the north.

North.description: Dense brush and trees march in a line along the cliff's edge to the northwest but the path immediately in front of you is relatively clear.

East.description: The flint path is visible between the outstretched arms of several trees.

South.description: An orderly row of dwarf-willows protects the garden from the strong sea breezes.

extras.text: This would be a very useful garden for any adventurer. Comfrey for cuts and bruises. Thyme for headaches. Vervain? Aphrodisiac and spell-component! You wonder why these people need that! Especially with witch-repelling elder growing next to it... Rue and rosemary for memory. Hmmm... You wish you had some of that pennyroyal when you went through the swamps to repel the insects... So many herbs here, and so little time!

rooms.name: A Cliff's Edge Clearing
rooms.description: Twisted and bent trees stand along the edges of this clearing. Tough salt grasses struggle for existence in this open place, but have been disturbed by some digging in the center of the glade. The wind seems very loud here after the protection of the forested areas surrounding you. It carries a very sad tune through the otherwise bright area.

North.description: The forest thickens ahead, but you could easily crash your way through.

Down.description: The dirt around the hole is loose and looks like it could be widened or loosened to open an entrance big enough for you to pass through if you had the right tool.

extras.text: Some animal has opened a small hole down into a natural passage below.

rooms.name: A Small Stand of Trees
rooms.description: You find yourself amidst a small, but tightly packed stand of trees. In fact, the trees are set so closely together that it's very difficult to weave your way among them. The ground is covered with last year's leaves.

North.description: The trees appear to thin to the north.

West.description: The trees thin just enough to glimpse a flint path.

extras.text: Oak leaves dominate, but you also spy a few maple leaves among the refuse.

rooms.name: A Flint Path
rooms.description: The gray stone of the path continues a steady climb north along the peninsula under the cool shadows of matching monoliths. A spattering of trees backs the monoliths to the east and the west. Dropping sharply away south of you, the path takes you near to the cliff's edge.

North.description: The flint path continues for some distance beneath a series of stone monoliths.

East.description: A tall, gray monolith blocks most of your view. An interesting carving of a stag tops the block. More carvings cover its face. Behind the stone, a stand of trees prevents you from seeing very far.

West.description: The tall monolith that stands here is topped with a pole or spike. Engravings cover its front. A small copse of trees guards the back of the stone.

Down.description: The flint path drops steeply away as it approaches the cliff's edge.

extras.text: Well, which one do you want to look at -- the stag-topped or the pole-topped?

The engravings on the pole-topped monolith show a group of young girls holding a cup in one hand, a rope or string in the other as they dance about a tall post. The ropes lead to the top of the post. All of the girls wear a crown of greenery. A few of them are shown drinking from their cups.
A skillfully carved stag head rides proudly on the top of the stone block. Engraved below is the scene of a man with a stag's head giving many people some type of drink.
Well, which one do you want to look at -- the one on the stag-topped or the one on the pole-topped?

Wide antlers grant the stag an air of majesty. You count seven tines on each side of the mighty rack. Black onyx has been inlaid as eyes, granting it a glittering stare that is incredibly life-like seen from this angle.
The pole is gaily colored with stones of red and green spiralling down its sides. Ribbons attached to its top flap in the easterly breeze that slips through the trees.

rooms.name: In the Bracken
rooms.description: Dead bushes and small trees crackle as you move through them. The still- living trees form such a good barrier here that nothing has been able to dislodge the dead plants. To the west, you have a nice view of the ocean. The back of a huge, gray stone blocks most of your view east. More bracken lies north, but it seems to be clearer to the south.

North.description: A similar mix of dead and living plants lies to your north.

East.description: The rough backside of a huge stone block marks the edge of a flint path.

South.description: The bracken has been cleared and a small garden of some kind planted to your south.

rooms.name: A Small Stand of Trees
rooms.description: This small gathering of trees stretches its branches forlornly over the edge of the cliff to the east. Their limbs are twisted together for mutual support in the face of the fierce winds from the sea. There seems to be a clearing to the south. Fewer trees have a foothold to the north. A not- quite-so-twisted group is west.

North.description: Fewer trees brave the wind to the north.

South.description: Another thick stand of trees surrounds a tiny clearing to the south.

West.description: A similar group of trees awaits you ahead.

extras.text: It's odd that these trees have spread their branches INTO the wind instead of away from it.

rooms.name: A Small Stand of Trees
rooms.description: The trees grow well here, reaching towards the sun in a sweet benediction to life. Their relatives to the east shelter this area from the worst of the winds off the sea. To the west, shelter is given by a large, rectangular block of stone that towers over even the tallest of these trees. More trees lie south and fewer to the north.

North.description: Heavy brush is preventing much tree growth to the north.

East.description: A similar, but more twisted group of trees lies east.

South.description: A heavy stand of trees lies south.

West.description: Around the stone, you see a flint path and another stone monolith facing this one from the other side of the path. The monolith is heavily carved.

Up.description: The trees rub twigs and rustle sadly in the slowed breezes above you, like cold children rubbing their hands together to keep warm. A single bright spot of green in the branches above catches your eye.

extras.text: Something has been stuck into the branches of the trees above.

rooms.name: A Flint Path
rooms.description: The gray stone of the path continues a steady north-south trek along the peninsula under the cool shadows of matching monoliths. A spattering of trees backs the monoliths to the east and the west. Laughter sounds from the trees to your northwest.

North.description: The flint path continues for some distance beneath a series of stone monoliths.

East.description: A tall gray monolith topped with the form of a recumbant young woman blocks most of your view, but you catch a glimpse of the sea through the thinning trees behind it.

South.description: The flint path runs south, towards the isthmus.

West.description: The carved figure of a smiling man tops the gray monolith. Deeply engraved figures stand below him on the face of the stone. The bough of a tree sneaks around the back of the monolith and across the path.

extras.text: Clad in loose flowing robes, holding a bladed weapon in one hand, and a cup in the other, he makes an unusual figure.

A sleeping young woman pillows her head on top of one arm with the other resting on her stomach. Her garment is shown draping closely about her in a series of folds as though it had twisted tight in some spiralling movement. A twining circlet of boughs graces her head even in sleep.

A deep engraving shows a young woman collapsed beneath a pole or post. Several other young women stand nearby, hanging onto ropes that run to the top of the pole with one hand and cups with the other. All are gaily dressed with crowns of greenery in their hair.
The smiling man stands behind a young woman resting on a large stone. In one hand, he holds a long knife or a short sword. It's hard to tell. Seagulls fill the sky behind him.
Well, which one do you want to look at -- the man-topped or the woman-topped?
Well, which one do you want to look at -- the ones on the man-topped or the ones on the woman-topped?

rooms.name: In the Bracken
rooms.description: Even the most skillful thief would have difficulty moving silently through this crackling mix of dead brush and live trees! They twine closely about each other as though the live embrace the dead in some eerie dance. The area to the north has much less dead overgrowth than to the south or west. Your view east is partially obscured by a large monolith.

North.description: A nicely wooded area lies to your north. The faint sound of laughter and music drifts to you on a lighter breeze.

East.description: The blank back of a stone monolith prevents you from seeing much more than the path to your east. The trees seem to be growing more thickly closer to the stone path.

South.description: A similar stand of thick bracken lies south.

rooms.name: Among the Bushes
rooms.description: Tough berry bushes send wiry roots down into the rocky face of the cliff and lean into the east wind. Several small animal trails wend a line between the bushes in mute evidence that their berries are a local taste-treat. More bushes lie north and west. A little ways ahead to the west, you see a tall block of stone thrusting straight up towards the sky. A small stand of trees lies to your south.

North.description: More berry bushes lie to the north.

South.description: Small trees dominate the bushes to the south. There must be more soil for them to root.

West.description: In the distance, you see a monstrous block of stone towering over the short bushes, shrubs, and small trees.

extras.text: The bushes are covered with the tiny fruits known as gooseberries.

rooms.name: Among the Bushes
rooms.description: A few scattered trees tower over the low growing bushes and shrubs here. Small animal trails wind a tortured path through the undergrowth to the east, south, and north. A large, gray block of stone blocks most of your view to the west, but you can still see the flint path and a matching block of stone on the other side of the path.

North.description: Tough shrubs and bushes grow to your north.

East.description: Tough bushes and shrubs cling tightly to the edge of a cliff.

South.description: Small trees have managed to gain a foothold to your south.

West.description: The backside of this stone monolith isn't very exciting, but if it's carved like the one across the way, moving around to its other side might prove more informative.

rooms.name: A Flint Path
rooms.description: The gray stone of the path continues a steady north-south trek along the peninsula under the cool shadows of matching monoliths. A spattering of trees backs the monoliths to the east and the west. Laughter sounds from the trees to your northwest.

North.description: The line of monoliths comes to an end just ahead, but the path continues.

East.description: A few scattered bushes and shrubs lie directly behind the great monolith. Your eyes are drawn to the top of the gray stone, to the dagger carved at the top, then down across an engraved scene on its face.

South.description: The flint path continues for some distance beneath a matched line of gray stone monoliths.

West.description: The monolith to your west is topped by a circlet of twined vines. Its face is deeply engraved with a detailed scene. Behind the massive monolith, trees twine branches with one another.

extras.text: Ironically, her tears fall into a patch of Forget-me-nots.
An inscription almost hidden behind grass reads: "Through the pain of One, Wishes granted to All"
Well, which ones do you want to look at -- the ones on the dagger-topped or the ones on the circlet-topped?
Well, which one do you want to look at -- the dagger-topped or the circlet-topped?

An amazingly detailed circlet carved to look like hemlock tops this stone. Its message of death seems to be carried out below in the scene of final preparations for a ritual sacrifice. Several smiling young men and women are tying another young woman to an altar stone of some kind with vines woven of hemlock twigs. A larger crowd looks on, smiling, and raises cups in a silent toast.

The dagger-crowned monolith shows a macabre scene of celebration. A group of happy revellers looks on as a young man in ornate robes carefully carves the symbol of twined vines into the stomach of a young woman. Tears of pain roll from her eyes and fall to the ground into a patch of flowers. A line of letters is inscribed at the base of the monolith.

rooms.name: A Small Stand of Trees
rooms.description: The young oaks and maples reach glad hands toward the sky, twining branches as they dance in the breezes. The melancholy you've felt on other parts of the headland seem to have been washed clear of your soul. Maybe it's the infectious influence of the gay music and laughter sounding from somewhere deeper in the trees to your west. Or is it from the trees to the north? A tangled web of bracken lies south, or you can step around a great block of stone onto a path to your east.

North.description: A thinner stand of trees lies north.

East.description: A tall, gray block of stone guards the edge of a flint path.

South.description: The tangles of dried, dead plants are left from previous years' growth. They would be very noisy to pass through, but passage is certainly possible.

West.description: The oaks and maples move softly in the wind.

rooms.name: A Small Stand of Trees
rooms.description: The trees cling to a tenuous lifespan here, twining branches, reaching happily towards the sun, and huddling together in the face of fierce gales. Oak, maple, and one lone rowan complete this grove. A clearing or, at the least, a thinning in the trees is to your north. The same grove you are in now continues to the east and the west. Open air at the cliff's edge is to your south.

North.description: The sound of merriment echoes from a clearing ahead.

East.description: More oak and maples stand together to your east.

West.description: A few trees lean over at the very edge of the cliff to your west.

extras.text: This tough tree, bane of witches, is having a very difficult time in this grove. The tree huddles among its fellows. It almost looks lonely -- standing, not touching the others -- almost... like an unwanted party guest.

rooms.name: A Small Stand of Trees
rooms.description: The trees here grow in an odd, circular pattern, as though none of them wish to be in the center. All have taken up a life of clinging to the cliff edges instead. The trees continue to the north and the east, while the land drops away to the sea to the south and the west.

North.description: The trees again cling to the edges of the land to your north, instead of spreading out across the open area.

East.description: More trees. Oak, maple, one lonely rowan...

extras.text: The middle of the stand of trees is scarred by a long-ago fire. Any tree that grew too closely must have been totally consumed.

rooms.name: A Small Ledge
rooms.description: You find yourself perched on a surprisingly stable ledge overlooking the sea.  The steep trail ascends back to the top of the cliff or you could follow the ledge north.  The stone beneath your feet seems strangely scuffed or scratched...

North.description: The ledge continues north.

extras.text: The ledge is covered in a mat of moss, but you can still make out where someone tried to carve something into the stone.
Crudely scratched into the rock is a single word:  Friends Below it is the rough drawing of a hemlock leaf.

rooms.name: Among the Bushes
rooms.description: Waist-high bushes covered with bright green berries are everywhere. They cling in an especially thick patch to the very edge of the cliff, overlooking the sea. You can examine more to the north or the south. To the west are fewer bushes, but you can see the back of a tall stone a ways off.

North.description: The bushes seem to thin a bit to the north.

South.description: A bright patch of blood and a few scattered tufts of fur mark an animal trail leading south.

West.description: Bushes and grass ripple in the wind as it passes across the peninsula. A tall stone stands guard a little ways ahead.

Down.description: There seems to be a steep trail leading downwards concealed by the thick gooseberry bushes.

extras.text: As you examine the patch more closely, you notice that it conceals a steep pathway leading downwards to a small ledge.
The bushes are covered with just-ripe gooseberries.

rooms.name: The Edge of the Plaza
rooms.description: You find yourself standing knee-deep in grasses and low-growing bushes at the very edge of a stone plaza. The stones show recent signs of a cleaning and there are clumps of grass strewn about. They must have been pulled from their positions among the stones. You can go into the plaza to the north, walk around a great stone to the west, or into more low bushes to the east or south.

North.description: A stone plaza stretches ahead of you in geometric symmetry.

East.description: Several bushes bearing green berries lie to the east.

South.description: Small animal trails wind through the bushes to the south.

West.description: A tall gray stone leans among the grasses, guarding the edge of a flint path into the plaza.

extras.text: The grass is a tough variety with wiry blades. It has been ripped from between the stones of the plaza ahead of you to the north and tossed carelessly here.

rooms.name: A Flint Path
rooms.description: The smooth path passes beneath the end pair of monoliths here. A small meadow lies to your west while twisted bracken marks the east. The path widens just ahead as it takes on another form.

North.description: The flint path widens into a plaza of some sort just ahead.

East.description: This stone is topped by a mass of vines or weeds. It's difficult to tell exactly what they are supposed to be. More of the same obscure a body in the carving below. Sharply pungent shrubs lie low against the ground in thick mats ahead.

South.description: The flint path dances beneath a line of tall gray monoliths.

West.description: A beautiful young woman beckons to you from atop this pillar. Something seems odd about her, but you can't quite place what. Her beauty is totally enchanting. An ocean scene covers the face of the monolith below her. Behind, a small meadow of very green grass looks inviting. You hear laughter in the distance, accompanied by music.

extras.text: Long tresses wind around her body, hiding her bare torso from view. She glances at you sidelong from sparkling, sea-green cabochon eyes. A faint smile twists her mouth up at the corners. Her finely webbed hands beckon to you. The tiny scales that cover her body are exquisitely carved. Wait a minute! Webbed hands? Scales?
On closer examination, you realize these are the same type of seaweed you've seen washed up on the shore, but twisted together with boughs of hemlock.
The broad, flat leaves look like no plant you've ever seen, but do seem familiar.
Selfless loss, Hemlock to adorn, New life from death, Through one scorned.
Well, which ones do you want to look at -- the ones on the vine-topped or the ones on the woman-topped?
Well, which one do you want to look at -- the vine-topped or the woman-topped?

The enchanting young woman teasingly beckons to you from her perch high above. Carved below, is a picture of her swimming away into the ocean. She looks very happy. Weeds trail behind her in the water. An inscription has been chiselled into the base.
A bundle of weeds or vines drapes the top of the stone. In the carving below, a group of people are wrapping the same type of weed around the body of a young woman lying on a cliff near the sea.

rooms.name: The Edge of the Plaza
rooms.description: You find yourself standing knee-deep in grasses and low-growing bushes at the very edge of a stone plaza. Tufts of grass have been thrown here after they were torn from between the stones of the plaza. You can go into the plaza to the north, walk around a great stone to the east, or go into a stand of trees to the west or the south.

North.description: A stone plaza stretches ahead of you in geometric symmetry.

East.description: A large stone monolith stands next to the flint path to your east. Something tells you that it would be best to enter the plaza on the path.

South.description: A small stand of trees dominated by oaks is to your south.

West.description: A thin row of trees blocks your view of whatever lies to your west, but there is space for you to walk between them if you're careful.

extras.text: The grass is a tough variety with wiry blades. It has been ripped from between the stones of the plaza ahead of you to the north and tossed carelessly here.

rooms.name: A Small Stand of Trees
rooms.description: You are in one of the last level areas on this side of the peninsula. Ahead of you, to the west, the land begins a steep drop towards the sea. The land to the north also dips, but not as drastically. More trees stand to your south.

North.description: The land descends slightly, giving the trees to the north the appearance of being shorter than those surrounding you.

East.description: A few scattered trees stand at the edge of a geometric plaza to your east.

South.description: A similar stand of trees is to your south.

West.description: As the land descends toward the sea, the trees become sparse.

rooms.name: The Edge of the Meadow
rooms.description: You leave the forest behind to stand at the edge of a seaside meadow. In the grass below you is a scene of drunken revelry like none you've ever imagined. The forest guards the meadow on all sides. They've chosen a very protected spot for merrymaking.

East.description: A small stand of trees protects the meadow from intrusion.

South.description: A burned track of grass leads from the meadow into the stand of trees to the south.

Down.description: Young men and women seem not to notice you as they dance about in the meadow below, splashing drink from the cups in their hands.

rooms.name: A Small Ledge
rooms.description: This section of ledge isn't as stable as that to the south. A large crack between it and the cliff is being widened by a tiny hemlock tree that has somehow taken root in this inhospitable place.

East.description: The waters below swirl into new shapes as they pass over unseen obstructions. A lull in the wind brings the haunting melody to your ears again and you find yourself fighting the urge to follow the sound straight out over the sea!

South.description: The ledge continues to the south.

extras.text: The tree has sent firm roots deep into the ledge. It leans outward, away from the cliff as if embracing the east wind. The leaves rustle and glisten. Moisture drips from them like tears.

Someone took much time and effort to lovingly chisel the face of the cliff. The carving shows a young girl and a large, strange looking woman sitting on the seashore together. The woman is giving the girl a hemlock bough. Words are carved below the picture.
Kindred souls, Love the Sea, One wish only, Grant to me

rooms.name: Among the Bushes
rooms.description: You find yourself standing in a narrow patch of berry bushes between the cliff's edge to the east and a stone plaza to the west. To your north, grasses ripple in the winds sweeping across this small peninsula. More bushes survive in the wider land south.

North.description: Bushes give way to windswept grasses as you approach the end of the headland.

South.description: The bushes to the south are much heavier with berries than those here.

West.description: The cleanly swept stones of a geometrically arranged plaza lie west.

rooms.name: The Flint Plaza
rooms.description: Smooth, interlocking pieces of fine, gray flint form a plaza of sorts. Subtle variations in the natural coloring of the stones have been used to form a wave-like pattern. You can step near the edge of the peninsula to the north, into a bush patch to the east or to the south or farther into the plaza to the west.

North.description: Wiry gray-green grass outlines the last true piece of land on the peninsula.

East.description: A few green berry bushes scatter across the land.

South.description: A few green berry bushes stand among discarded clumps of grass to the south.

West.description: The smooth stone continues to the west, but you notice a change in the pattern of the stones...

extras.text: The pieces have been carefully chosen and matched for color, then inlaid to form a wave pattern similar to what you see in the seas below this headland.

rooms.name: The Flint Plaza
rooms.description: You stand at the center of the flint plaza, at the precise spot where the two stylized patterns meld together, forming a single shape. You can go north to a raised block of stone or follow the flint path away to the south. The plaza continues to the east and to the west.

North.description: A raised block of stone dominates the plaza ahead.

East.description: A beautiful pattern of waves inlaid in subtle colors marks the plaza to the east.

South.description: A path of smoothed flint stones leads south in a straight line beneath matching rows of great, carved monoliths.

West.description: An interlocked pattern of leaves has been carefully inlaid in the plaza to the west.

extras.text: The detailed melding of the two patterns is flawless. You find it hard to trace the exact point where they merge, but the final product, in the precise center, is exquisite -- a twined wreath of hemlock leaves wrapped in waves from the sea in the never-ending caress found only in the perfection of a circle.

rooms.name: The Flint Plaza
rooms.description: At first, you think you may have been mistaken about this being a stone plaza, but on closer inspection you realize that you do stand on paving. It has been inlaid with stone of such subtle green variation in color that it gives you the impression of standing on a weave of hemlock boughs. Each leaf has been represented here in exceptional detail. The plaza continues to the east. You can step into a small stand of trees to the north, south, or west.

North.description: The gnarled remains of a single hemlock tree stand to your north.

East.description: The intricate stone hemlock pattern leads to the east.

South.description: Grass grows among scattered trees to your south.

West.description: A small stand of trees grips the land to the west.

extras.text: Delicate veins have been inlaid into each leaf with contrasting gray stone. The effect is incredible. It is though you stand on a tree top.

rooms.name: A Small Stand of Trees
rooms.description: The group of trees stands huddled together, ashamed to witness the scene in the meadow below. Or, is it the plaza they don't like? It's hard to tell, but a distinct wave of animosity rolls over you and they creak in menace. You can leave the trees to the north and the east. The trees to your south are on slightly higher ground. Those to the west dangle over the edge of the cliff.

North.description: Only saplings stand among the grasses to your north.

East.description: A small stone plaza lies to your east.

West.description: A few trees cling to the very edge of the cliff. The sound of the sea can be heard faintly.

rooms.name: A Small Stand of Trees
rooms.description: This last line of trees hangs onto the edge of the cliff for their very lives. Part of the peninsula has obviously fallen away since they were young, leaving them with the barest bit of land to hold. As you look about, you are suddenly hit by a burst of empathy that brings you to your knees in tears. Someone is very powerful and very unhappy. You can enter a more stable, grassy area to the south, or a wooded area to the east. To the north, you can see the ocean. Your view to the west is blocked by trees.

East.description: A small stand of trees guards the east.

rooms.name: On the Edge
rooms.description: Short salt grasses whip in the wind, bending in rippling cascades at the very edge of the land mass. You feel as though you could see for miles. Unfortunately, a very thick mist has bound itself to the peninsula from the north. To the east you can see the first tendrils of mist extending about the side of the cliff. Waist-high bushes dominate the area to your south.

South.description: Several berry bushes stand among the grasses to the south.

West.description: The narrow strip of grass widens to the west.

extras.text: The mists roil and swirl, churned by something inside that you cannot see... Thin tendrils reach out towards where you stand...

rooms.name: In the Grasses
rooms.description: Short salt grasses ripple at the wind's touch. They lash your knees repeatedly. Torn chunks of sod lie sadly about, ripped from their home in the plaza to the south and the west. Shorter grasses wave at you from the east. The land drops off slightly to your north onto some type of gravelled ledge.

North.description: You can jump down to the gravelled ledge with no problem here.

East.description: A very narrow strip of land marches around the northern edge of the plaza.

South.description: A small plaza paved in subtle shades of flint lies to the south.

West.description: A raised stone block stands guard at the northern edge of the plaza to your west.

Down.description: You can jump down to the gravelled ledge with no problem here.

rooms.name: A Square Stone Block
rooms.description: A large, square block of stone has been dragged here and set in place at the very edge of the flint plaza. Relief carvings of twining leaves cover the sides. A wave pattern graces the cap. Ropes have been attached to four iron rings set into the corners. Short grasses lie tightly against its base.

North.description: A vast, white wall of mist rises from below the gravelled ledge to tower accusingly over the stone.

East.description: Short grasses ripple in the wind to your east. A mist is closing in on them steadily.

South.description: The inlaid flint plaza lies to your south.

West.description: Knee-high grasses grow in the shelter of the stone to the west.

Up.description: Something is keeping the mists overhead at bay. They churn just above you as though stopped by an invisible wall.

Down.description: Something seems to be inscribed at the head of the stone.

extras.text: The stone is very solid and has been covered with relief carvings on its side and cap. The grassy growth surrounding its base shows that it has been here for several years at the very least. An inscription stands out at the head.
Hemlock and rowan twist and turn around each other in an unending dance around the sides of the stone.
A stylized depiction of the ocean swirls across the top of the stone.
The iron rings are sunk deeply into the stone.
The slender ropes were twisted together from a combination of hemlock and rowan twigs. They are rough, but very strong.
Exhaustion shows the worthy soul Sea's love and wishes Hemlock and Rowan gambol Honor, Scorn, Transform!

rooms.name: In the Grasses
rooms.description: Grass wraps about your knees as you try to walk through this patch of growth. Something crackles and breaks unseen below your feet. Wetness lies everywhere and dampens your clothing. A heavy fog seems to be moving in from the north, across a gravelled ledge below you. To the east is a raised block of stone set at the northernmost point of the flint plaza that spreads to your south. A few saplings stand alone to your west.

North.description: The drop looks a little too steep to just step off here, and the mists make a flying leap seem not very wise.

East.description: A raised block of stone stands to your east. It seems somehow... menacing...

South.description: The flint plaza opens to your south.

West.description: Three saplings stand alone among the grass to the west.

Up.description: The clear sky is still visible against the encroaching mists.

Down.description: Twigs and old leaves have been scattered through the grasses here.

extras.text: The twigs and leaves are a mix of hemlock and rowan.
The hemlock pieces are waterlogged and covered with fine grains of salt.
The rowan pieces, while fresh, are bone-dry. They even seem to have absorbed water from around themselves.

rooms.name: On the Edge
rooms.description: Tufts of salt grasses grow among the slender saplings planted here. These young trees seem to be the vanguard for the forest to your south, because none can be found farther on. A blank, white mist moving in from the north coats the area around you in dampness. The open sea is faintly visible to your west. Thick grasses grow to your east.

North.description: A heavy sea mist rises up the cliff face from the ocean below. It coats your face with salty wetness like tears.

East.description: The dull green grasses grow to knee height to your east.

South.description: A small stand of trees sways toward you, moving gently in the breeze.

West.description: The mist to this side is not yet as thick as that to the north. It gathers and begins rising more heavily even as you watch. Something about it makes you turn away, blinking tears of rage from your eyes.

Up.description: The white mist is sending faint streamers into the sky above you.

Down.description: The grass bends sharply back and forth in the swirling winds.

extras.text: The three rowan saplings are completely dry, as though the sea mists cannot touch them at all. The grasses all around them are wet. How odd.

rooms.name: A Gravelled Ledge
rooms.description: Someone has covered this natural ledge in gravel, making it very difficult to keep firm footing. A few twigs seem to have dropped here from above. The ledge slopes steeply toward a drop-off into the unknown. Unknown because before you is an impenetrable wall of mist. In fact, it feels like the mist is pressing you back... urging you back up onto the peninsula!

North.description: It's not easy, but you find you can press your way into the mists...

East.description: The white breath of the sea is absolutely impenetrable on this side.

South.description: The slope ascends to the south, back to the height of the peninsula.

West.description: The gravelled ledge continues to the west.

Up.description: The heavy mists rise above your head, forming a low ceiling of tiny water droplets that never quite seem to strike you.

Down.description: The ledge drops off into nothingness....

extras.text: The mist seethes before you, pressing back... back...
Rowan twigs lie scattered across the gravel.

rooms.name: A Gravelled Ledge
rooms.description: Someone has covered this natural ledge in gravel, making it very difficult to keep firm footing. Many twigs lie strewn about in a concentric circle except for one strip down the middle where something has slid through the gravel and off the edge into nothingness...

North.description: The mists roll back from the edge here, offering you a glimpse of open air.

East.description: The gravelled ledge continues to your east.

South.description: It's a steep climb up to the peninsula. Better pick your feet up higher.

West.description: The gravelled ledge continues to the west.

Up.description: The mists rise in a wall above you but can't seem to bend forward over this center section of the ledge...

extras.text: The mist seethes before you, pressing back... back...
Rowan twigs lie scattered across the gravel.

rooms.name: A Gravelled Ledge
rooms.description: Someone has covered this natural ledge in gravel, making it very difficult to keep firm footing. A few twigs seem to have dropped here from above. The ledge slopes steeply toward a drop-off into the unknown. Unknown because before you is an impenetrable wall of mist. In fact, it feels like the mist is pressing you back... urging you back up onto the peninsula!

North.description: It's not easy, but you find you can press your way into the mists...

East.description: The gravelled ledge continues to the east.

South.description: The land climbs up sharply to your south. You'd better pick up your feet if you want to go back to the heights.

West.description: The thick, impassable mists press you back onto the ledge. It doesn't appear that you can go that way...

Up.description: The heavy mists rise above your head, forming a low ceiling of tiny water droplets that never quite seem to strike you.

Down.description: The ledge drops off into nothingness....

extras.text: The mist seethes before you, pressing back... back...
Rowan twigs lie scattered across the gravel.

rooms.name: In the Meadow
rooms.description: Knee-deep grass coated with sea-spray caresses your lower legs as you descend into this vision of merry-making. Everywhere about you, young men and women lie sprawled in exhaustion or dance wildly with abandon. Rises to the east and west prevent your passage in those directions, but the meadow broadens ahead of you to the west. You can ascend from the meadow in an easterly direction.

North.description: The sharp rise of the headland is unclimbable to your north.

East.description: You can go up and back into the trees to your east. The climb doesn't look too bad.

South.description: The sharp rise of the headland is unclimbable to your south.

West.description: You must descend once more to reach the edge of the meadow.

Up.description: The meadow begins at the lip of the bowl above you. The climb looks fairly easy.

Down.description: Dancers move in a ring to the sound of tambours, drums, and pipes below you.

rooms.name: In the Meadow
rooms.description: The revelry continues here, at the very edge of the sea. The tall meadow grasses sway in time to the music right along with the dancers. Their skill is amazing. To the west, the ocean swirls close to the edge, washing the meadow grass in spray. More dancers shift and sway to the north. To the south, they are gathered about a large post. You can ascend back to the trees east of here.

North.description: Another group of dancers is gathered about a kettle of some sort.

East.description: Ouch! That rock hurt! Maybe if you picked your feet up a bit and climbed up to the other part of the meadow, instead of trying to walk through rock...

South.description: Dancers twist and leap in a circle around a gaily decorated post.

West.description: The sea sweeps inward from the deeps, assaulting the meadow time and again with spray. The air at the meadow's edge is white with mist. As you reach your hand outward, it encounters an impenetrable barrier, unseen in the mists.

Up.description: The skies far above the meadow are misty white, but the path up to the main portion of the headland is still clear.

Down.description: The meadow grasses are wet with spray and hopelessly trampled. This celebration seems to have been going on for a long time. I wonder where they get so much energy?

rooms.name: In the Meadow
rooms.description: A crackling fire dances beneath a large cauldron, filled with a brew of some sort. Dancers stand about the pot, waiting for their cups to be filled. As each cup is topped off, the dancers twirl off into another mad pattern. You can go deeper into the meadow to the south. The ocean washes close to the meadow to the north and the west. A white cliff bounds the east.
